definitions.definition: A sparkling white wine made from a blend of grapes , especially Chardonnay and pinot , produced in Champagne , France , by the méthode champenoise .
Any sparkling wine made by the méthode champenoise .
A very pale brownish - gold colour , similar to that of champagne.
the base of the shield, either flat-topped (like the chief at the top of the shield) or curved (as in a mount or trimount ).

main_definition: ( countable , uncountable ) A sparkling white wine made from a blend of grapes , especially Chardonnay and pinot , produced in Champagne , France , by the méthode champenoise .
secondary_definitions: ( countable , uncountable , informal ) Any sparkling wine made by the méthode champenoise .
( countable , uncountable , informal ) Any sparkling white wine.
( countable ) A very pale brownish - gold colour , similar to that of champagne.
( heraldry ) (An ordinary occupying) the base of the shield, either flat-topped (like the chief at the top of the shield) or curved (as in a mount or trimount ).
